Header: Seeking guidance of the Sangha is important to establish good governance; President
Content: President Maithripala Sirisena has emphasized the importance of adhering to seeking the guidance of the members of the Maha Sangha to establish good governance in the country. The President was speaking at an event in Kandy. It was organized to vest in the Sangha the Sadaham Medura built in the Warathenna Siri Mahabodhi Udakukkepa Seema Maalakaya. The vesting of the Sadaham Medura built in the Siri Mahabodhi Udakukkepa Seema Maalakaya in Waratenne coming under the Udarata Amarapura Sasanajohikakaraka Sangha Sabha took place under the patronage of President Maithripala Sirisena last afternoon. The construction was carried with the financial contribution of all the Dayaka Sabha members and the labour contribution of the Army. The President unveiled the plaque amidst the chanting of Seth Pirith by members of the Maha Sangha. Thereafter the President undertook an observation visit. The Supreme Mahanayake the Most Ven. Kotugoda Dhammawsa Nayake Thera presented the Sannaspathra to the members of the Sasanajothikaraka Sangha Sabha the Chief Sanghanayake of the Udarata Amarapura Chapter of the Sasanajothikaraka Sangha Sabha the Ven. Wattegama Dhammaawasa Thera. The President presented the Vijinipatha to the Chief Sanghanayake. Addressing the function that followed President Maithripala Sirisena pointed out that the life of the Budhha Sasana is the set of disciplinary rules bestowed on the Maha Sangha.
